00058 /**
00059  * Read in a file of probe IDs
00060  */
00061 void EngineUtil::readProbeFile( std::vector< std::vector< probeid_t > > &probeIds, 
00062                                 const std::string& probeFileName) {
00063 
00064     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00065     probeid_t probeId;
00066     int channelIx = 0;
00067     /* sanity checks */
00068     if (tsv.open(probeFileName) != TSV_OK) {
00069         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(probeFileName) + " to read.");
00070     }
00071 
00072     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00073         tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00074     }
00075     else {
00076         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probe_id column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00077     }
00078 
00079     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "channel") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00080         tsv.bind(0, "channel", &channelIx, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00081     }
00082 //     else
00083 //         Err::errAbort("Unable to find channel column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00084 
00085     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00086         if (channelIx >= probeIds.size()) {
00087             probeIds.resize(channelIx + 1);
00088         }
00089         probeIds[channelIx].push_back(TO_ZEROBASED(probeId));
00090     }
00091     tsv.close();
00092 }
00093 
00094 void EngineUtil::readProbeFile(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds, 
00095                                const std::string& probeFileName) {
00096 
00097     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00098     probeid_t probeId;
00099     /* sanity checks */
00100     if (tsv.open(probeFileName) != TSV_OK) 
00101         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(probeFileName) + " to read.");
00102     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
00103         tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00104     else
00105         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probe_id column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00106 
00107     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00108         probeIds.push_back(TO_ZEROBASED(probeId));
00109     }
00110     tsv.close();
00111 }
00112 
00113 void EngineUtil::readProbeFiles(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds,
00114                                 const vector<std::string>& probeFileNames) {
00115     for (int i=0;i<probeFileNames.size();i++) {
00116         readProbeFile(probeIds,probeFileNames[i]);
00117     }
00118 }

00121 /**
00122  * Read in a file of probeset names or IDs. IDs trumps names.
00123  */
00124 void EngineUtil::readProbeSetFile(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets, 
00125                                   const std::string& probeSetFileName) {
00126     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00127     string probeset;
00128 
00129     //
00130     if (tsv.open(probeSetFileName) != TSV_OK) 
00131         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + probeSetFileName + " to read.");
00132 
00133     //
00134     int cidx;
00135     // we try all of these in a case insenstive manner as other people like to use spaces.
00136     // we (APT) dont like spaces in column names as that causes problems
00137     // (Some programs treat spaces as tabs.)
00138     if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00139       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00140     }
00141     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00142       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00143     }
00144     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe set id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00145       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00146     }
00147     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_name",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00148       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00149     }
00150     else
00151         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probeset_id or probeset_name column in file '"+probeSetFileName+"'");
00152 
00153     // slurp the list.
00154     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00155         probeSets.push_back(probeset);
00156     
00157     tsv.close();
00158 }
00159 
00160 void EngineUtil::readProbeSetFiles(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets, 
00161                                    const std::vector<std::string>& probeSetFileNames) {
00162     for (int i=0;i<probeSetFileNames.size();i++) {
00163         readProbeSetFile(probeSets,probeSetFileNames[i]);
00164     }
00165 }

00167 /**
00168  * Read in the probe class file
00169  *
00170  * @param file   - The file to read
00171  * @param masks  - Vector of probe masks to fill in
00172  */
00173 void EngineUtil::readProbeClassFile(const string &file, const int arraySize, 
00174                                     map<string, vector<bool> > &classMap) {
00175     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00176     int probeId = 0;
00177     string probeClass;
00178     map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator classMapIter;
00179 
00180 
00181     tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00182     tsv.bind(0, "class", &probeClass, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00183     if (tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00184         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + file + "' to read.");
00185 
00186 
00187     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00188         classMapIter = classMap.find(probeClass);
00189         if (classMapIter == classMap.end()) {
00190             classMap[probeClass].resize(arraySize,false);
00191         }
00192         classMap[probeClass].at(probeId-1) = true;
00193     }
00194     tsv.close();
00195 }

00198 /**
00199  * Return true if the qType of chip is found in the list of possible
00200  * types that are ok. Note that this is a case sensitive operation and
00201  * is meant to be so.
00202  * We want to be restrictive to avoid problems later on.
00203  * Filesystems we care about are at least case-preserving (HFS+)
00204  */
00205 bool EngineUtil::checkChipTypeOk(const std::string &qType, const std::vector<std::string> &possibleTypes) {
00206     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < possibleTypes.size(); i++) {
00207         if (qType == possibleTypes[i]) {
00208             return true;
00209         }
00210     }
00211     // maybe they have the wrong case?
00212     // we always return false, but we can say what is wrong.
00213     std::string qType_lower=Util::downcaseString(qType);
00214     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < possibleTypes.size(); i++) {
00215         std::string possibleType_lower=Util::downcaseString(possibleTypes[i]);
00216         if (qType_lower == possibleType_lower) {
00217             Verbose::out(1,"Case mismatch in chiptypes. ('"+qType+"'!='"+possibleTypes[i]+"') Case must match.");
00218             return false;
00219         }
00220     }
00221 
00222     return false;
00223 }
00224 
00225 /**
00226  * Check chip types in TSV file against those in chipTypes vector
00227  */
00228 void EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(const string &path, 
00229                                       const std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes,
00230                                       bool mustSee) {
00231     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00232     string chip;
00233     vector<string> chipSeen;
00234     if (tsv.open(path) != TSV_OK)
00235         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + path + "' to read.");
00236     bool chipMatch = false;
00237     if (chipTypes[0] == "")
00238         chipMatch = true; // treat empty as wildcard.
00239     while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip-type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00240         chipSeen.push_back(chip);
00241         for (int i = 0; i<chipTypes.size(); i++) {
00242             if (chip == chipTypes[i])
00243                 chipMatch = true;
00244         }
00245     }
00246     if (!chipMatch && (chipSeen.size() > 0 || mustSee)) {
00247         string foundTypes, expectedTypes;
00248         for (int i=0; i<chipSeen.size(); i++)
00249             foundTypes += chipSeen[i] + ", ";
00250         for (int i=0; i<chipTypes.size(); i++)
00251             expectedTypes += chipTypes[i] + ", ";
00252 
00253         Err::errAbort("Chiptype(s) [" + foundTypes + "] in file '" + path + "' does not match the set of valid chip types [" + expectedTypes + "]");
00254     }
00255 }
00256 
00257 /**
00258  * Check to make sure that there is at least one match between the two
00259  * vectors of chip types. Call Err::errAbort() if not.
00260  */
00261 void EngineUtil::checkChipTypeVectors(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesOk,
00262                                       std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesCheck) {
00263     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesCheck.size(); i++)
00264         if (checkChipTypeOk(chipTypesCheck[i],chipTypesOk))
00265             return;
00266     std::string chipTypeString = "";
00267     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesOk.size(); i++)
00268         chipTypeString += chipTypesOk[i] + ", ";
00269     Verbose::out(1,"Expected Chip Types: " + chipTypeString);
00270     chipTypeString = "";
00271     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesCheck.size(); i++)
00272         chipTypeString += chipTypesCheck[i] + ", ";
00273     Verbose::out(1,"Found Chip Types: " + chipTypeString);
00274     Err::errAbort("No matching chip types found.");
00275 }
00276 
00277 /** 
00278  * Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the
00279  * chiptypes supported and number or probes on them. Treats the empty
00280  * string "" as a wildcard, so if chipTypes contains "" then any chip
00281  * type is accepted, but only if number of probes is correct. Calls
00282  * Err::errAbort() if something is wrong.
00283  * 
00284  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that are compatible.
00285  * @param probeCount - How many probes (aka features, ada cels) should be on array.
00286  * @param celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.
00287  */
00288 void EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, uint32_t probeCount,
00289                                    std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, uint32_t rows, uint32_t cols) {
00290     map<string,string> seenFiles;
00291     string root;
00292     FusionCELData cel;
00293   
00294     vector<string>::iterator celIx;
00295     bool allOk = true;
00296     int maxWarnings = 0;
00297     int vLevel = 1;
00298     for (celIx = celFiles.begin(); celIx != celFiles.end(); celIx++) {
00299         root = Fs::basename(*celIx);
00300         /* check to see we haven't seen this file before. */
00301         if (seenFiles.find(root) != seenFiles.end()) {
00302             Err::errAbort("Filename: '" + root + "' seen multiple times. Filenames must be unique.");
00303         }
00304         else {
00305             seenFiles[root] = "seen";
00306         }
00307   
00308         try {
00309           std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(*celIx);
00310           cel.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00311             if (!cel.ReadHeader())
00312               Err::errAbort("Can't read file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name));
00313 
00314             bool hack = false;
00315             std::vector<std::wstring> data_channels = cel.GetChannels();
00316             if (data_channels.empty()) {
00317                 std::wstring temp = L"Default Group";
00318                 data_channels.push_back(temp);
00319             }
00320             else if (data_channels.size() > 1) {
00321                 affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericData *gd = cel.GetGenericData();
00322                 if (gd != NULL) {
00323                     if (gd->DataGroupCnt() != data_channels.size()) {
00324                         // Falcon Cel files with QC info have 3 data groups and two channels
00325                         // Internal single channel cel files from MC system at one point reported two channels, but only had one data group
00326                         if (gd->DataGroupCnt() == 1) {
00327                             Verbose::out(1,"WARNING: Bogus multi channel cel file hack triggered for cel file '"+*celIx+"'.");
00328                             hack = true;
00329                             std::wstring temp = L"Default Group";
00330                             data_channels.clear();
00331                             data_channels.push_back(temp);
00332                         }
00333                     }
00334                 }
00335             }
00336             for (int chanIx = 0; chanIx < data_channels.size(); chanIx++) {
00337                 if (!hack) {
00338                     cel.SetActiveDataGroup(data_channels[chanIx]);
00339                 }
00340 
00341                 if (cel.GetNumCells() != probeCount) {
00342                     Verbose::out(vLevel, "Wrong number of cells in channel " + ToStr(chanIx) + ": Expecting: " + ToStr(probeCount) + " and " +
00343                                  *celIx + " has: " + ToStr(cel.GetNumCells()));
00344                     allOk = false;
00345                 }
00346                 else if (cel.GetCols() != cols || cel.GetRows() != rows) {
00347                     Verbose::out(vLevel, "Row/Col mismatch in channel " + ToStr(chanIx) + ". Expecting " + ToStr(rows) + " rows and " + 
00348                                  ToStr(cols) + " cols. " + *celIx + " has " + ToStr(cel.GetRows()) +
00349                                  " rows and " + ToStr(cel.GetCols()) + " cols.");
00350                     allOk = false;
00351                 }
00352             }
00353             if (!checkChipTypeOk("", chipTypes) && 
00354                 !checkChipTypeOk(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetChipType()), chipTypes)) {
00355                 Verbose::out(vLevel, "Wrong CEL ChipType: expecting: '" + chipTypes[0]  + "' and " +
00356                              *celIx + " is: '" + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetChipType()) + "'");
00357                 allOk = false;
00358             }
00359     
00360             if (allOk == false) { 
00361                 maxWarnings++; 
00362             }
00363             if (maxWarnings > 10) {
00364                 vLevel = 2;
00365             }
00366             cel.Close();
00367         }
00368         catch (...)
00369         {
00370             Err::errAbort("Can't read file: " + ToStr(*celIx));
00371         }
00372     }
00373     if (!allOk) {
00374         Err::errAbort("Different chiptypes or probe counts found. Only first 10 errors printed, see log for rest.");
00375     }
00376 }
00377 
00378 /** 
00379  * Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the
00380  * given analysis type.
00381  * 
00382  * @param analysisName - Name of the analysis to be checked e.g. gc-correction.
00383  * @param celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.
00384  */
00385 void EngineUtil::checkCelAnalysisType(std::string analysisName, std::vector<std::string> &celFiles) 
00386 {
00387     map<string,string> seenFiles;
00388     string root;
00389     FusionCELData cel;
00390   
00391     vector<string>::iterator celIx;
00392     bool allOk = true;
00393     int maxWarnings = 0;
00394     int vLevel = 1;
00395 
00396         int igc_correction = analysisName.find ("gc-correction");
00397         int isst = analysisName.find ("scale-intensities");
00398 
00399         int ifind = analysisName.find ("gc-sst-");
00400 
00401         if (ifind != -1)
00402         {
00403                 igc_correction = 1;
00404                 isst = 1;
00405         }
00406 
00407     for (celIx = celFiles.begin(); celIx != celFiles.end(); celIx++) 
00408         {
00409         root = Fs::basename(*celIx);
00410 
00411         /* check to see we haven't seen this file before. */
00412         if (seenFiles.find(root) != seenFiles.end())
00413             Err::errAbort("Filename: '" + root + "' seen multiple times. Filenames must be unique.");
00414         else 
00415                         seenFiles[root] = "seen";
00416         try 
00417                 {
00418                         std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(*celIx);
00419                         cel.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00420             
00421                         if (!cel.ReadHeader())
00422               Err::errAbort("Can't read file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name));
00423 
00424                         wstring gc_correction = cel.GetAlgorithmParameter (L"gc-correction");
00425                         wstring sst = cel.GetAlgorithmParameter (L"SST");
00426 
00427                         if (igc_correction >= 0 && gc_correction.length () >  0)
00428                         {
00429                                 Verbose::out (vLevel,"gc-correction has already been performed on " + ToStr(*celIx));
00430                                 allOk = false;
00431                         }                       
00432                         
00433                         if (isst >= 0 && sst.length () >  0)
00434                         {
00435                                 Verbose::out (vLevel,"sst has already been performed on " + ToStr(*celIx));
00436                                 allOk = false;
00437                         }
00438 
00439             cel.Close();
00440         }
00441         catch (...)
00442         {
00443             Err::errAbort("Can't read file: " + ToStr(*celIx));
00444         }
00445     }
00446     
00447         if (!allOk) 
00448         Err::errAbort("Cel files can not be processed using chipstream: " + analysisName);
00449 }
00450 
00451 /** 
00452 =======
00453  * @brief Get a list from a text file to select a subset of probe sets for
00454  * analysis.
00455  * 
00456  * @param fileName - Path to file for reading probe subset from.
00457  * @param psGroups - Groups to be filled in, must be deleted later
00458  * @param psNameLoadMap - Map of probesets names to be loaded which is
00459  * filled in.
00460  */
00461 void EngineUtil::makePSetNameSubset(const std::string &fileName, 
00462                                     std::vector<ProbeSetGroup *> &psGroups, 
00463                                     std::map<std::string, bool> &psNameLoadMap) {
00464     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00465     std::string probeset;
00466     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00467     if (tsv.open(fileName.c_str()) != TSV_OK) 
00468         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + fileName + " to read.");
00469 
00470     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00471         psNameLoadMap[probeset] = true;
00472         ProbeSetGroup *ps = new ProbeSetGroup();
00473         ps->probeSetNames.push_back(Util::cloneString(probeset.c_str()));
00474         psGroups.push_back(ps);
00475     }
00476     tsv.close();
00477 }
00478 
00479 /** 
00480  * Open up a pgf and clf file pair and read the valid chiptypes
00481  * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00482  * of probes expected from them.
00483  * 
00484  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00485  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00486  * @param pgfFile - Name of pgf file to be opened and read from.
00487  * @param clfFile - Name of clf file to be opened and read from.
00488  */
00489 void EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, 
00490                                 colrow_t& rowCount,
00491                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00492                                 int& probeCount,
00493                                 const std::string &pgfFile, 
00494                                 const std::string &clfFile) {
00495     PgfFile pgf;
00496     ClfFile clf;
00497     /* Fill in the chiptypes from the pgf file. */
00498     if (pgf.open(pgfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00499         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getChipType() - Can't open Pgf file: '" + pgfFile + "' to read.");
00500     }
00501     chipTypes.clear();
00502     string chip;
00503     while (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00504         chipTypes.push_back(chip);
00505     }
00506     pgf.close();
00507 
00508     /* Fill in the probecount from the clf file. */
00509     if (clf.open(clfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00510         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getChipType() - Can't open clf file: '" + clfFile + "' to read.");
00511     }
00512     int rows = 0, cols = 0;
00513     if (clf.m_tsv.getHeader("rows", rows) != TSV_OK) 
00514         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getPgfChipType() - Clf file format not valid, no 'rows' field.");
00515     if (clf.m_tsv.getHeader("cols", cols) != TSV_OK) 
00516         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getPgfChipType() - Clf file format not valid, no 'cols' field.");
00517     rowCount = rows;
00518     colCount = cols;
00519     probeCount = (uint32_t)rows * cols;
00520     clf.close();
00521 }
00522 
00523 /** 
00524  * Open up a spf (simple probe format) file and read the valid chiptypes 
00525  * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00526  * of probes expected.
00527  * 
00528  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00529  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to spf file.
00530  * @param spfFile - Name of spf file to be opened and read from.
00531  */
00532 void EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(std::vector<std::string>& chipTypes, 
00533                                 colrow_t& rowCount, 
00534                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00535                                 int& probeCount,
00536                                 int& probeSetCount,
00537                                 const std::string& spfFile) {
00538     TsvFile tsv;
00539     /* Fill in the chiptypes from the pgf file. */
00540     if (tsv.open(spfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00541         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Can't open file: '" + spfFile + "' to read.");
00542     }
00543     chipTypes.clear();
00544     string chip;
00545     while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00546         chipTypes.push_back(chip);
00547     }
00548     int rows = 0, cols = 0, probesets = 0;
00549     if (tsv.getHeader("num-rows", rows) != TSV_OK) 
00550         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-rows' field.");
00551     rowCount = rows;
00552     if (tsv.getHeader("num-cols", cols) != TSV_OK) 
00553         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-cols' field.");
00554     colCount = cols;
00555     probeCount = (uint32_t)rows * cols;
00556     if (tsv.getHeader("num-probesets", probesets) != TSV_OK) 
00557         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-probesets' field.");
00558     probeSetCount = probesets;
00559 
00560     tsv.close();
00561 
00562   
00563 }
00564   
00565 /** 
00566  * Open up a cdf file and get the chip type (i.e. 'Mapping250K_Sty') and number
00567  * of probes on the chip.
00568  * 
00569  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00570  * @param rowCount - Number of rows on the chip.
00571  * @param colCount - Number of columns on chip.
00572  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00573  * @param cdfFile - Name of cdf file to be opened and read from.
00574  */
00575 void EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, 
00576                                 colrow_t& rowCount, 
00577                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00578                                 int& probeCount,
00579                                 int& probeSetCount,
00580                                 const std::string &cdfFile) {
00581     FusionCDFData cdf;
00582     std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(cdfFile);
00583     cdf.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00584     try {
00585         if (!cdf.ReadHeader()) {
00586             Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getCdfChipType() - Can't read header for " +
00587                           FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name) +
00588                           ". Description: " + cdf.GetError());
00589         }
00590     }
00591     catch(...) {
00592       Err::errAbort("Can't read file: " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name));
00593     }
00594     chipTypes.clear();
00595     chipTypes = cdf.GetChipTypes();
00596     FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdf.GetHeader();
00597     rowCount = cdfHeader.GetRows();
00598     colCount = cdfHeader.GetCols();
00599     probeCount = (uint32_t)rowCount * colCount;
00600     probeSetCount = cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets();
00601 }
00602 
00603 /**
00604  * @brief Print out a header and then a series of self documenting
00605  * objects.
00606  * @param header - Descriptive header for this collection of self documenting objects.
00607  * @param doc - Collection of self documenting objects.
00608  */
00609 void EngineUtil::printSelfDocs(const char *header, vector<SelfDoc> doc) {
00610     unsigned int i = 0;
00611 
00612     int maxLength = 0;
00613     int extraChars = 3;
00614     cout << endl << header << endl;
00615     for (i=0; i < doc.size(); i++) {
00616         string s = doc[i].getDocName();
00617         maxLength = max((int)maxLength, (int)s.length());
00618     }
00619     maxLength += 3 + extraChars;
00620     maxLength = min(maxLength, 25);
00621     for (i=0; i < doc.size(); i++) {
00622         int currentLength = 0;
00623         string s = doc[i].getDocName();
00624         cout << "   " << s;
00625         currentLength = s.length() + 3;
00626         while (currentLength < maxLength) {
00627             cout.put(' ');
00628             currentLength++;
00629         }
00630         PgOptions::printStringWidth(doc[i].getDocDescription().c_str(), maxLength, currentLength);
00631         cout << endl;
00632     }
00633 }
00634 
00635 /**
00636  * Print out a little ditty for the given type of self documenting object.
00637  *
00638  * @param query - type of analysis/adjustment/summarization information is desired for.
00639  */
00640 void EngineUtil::explainParameter(const std::string& query) {
00641     ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
00642     PmAdjusterFactory aFactory;
00643     QuantMethodFactory qFactory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00644     QuantMethodFactory gFactory(QuantMethodFactory::GenoType);
00645     AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory;
00646     vector<vector<SelfDoc> > docs;
00647 
00648   
00649     docs.push_back(cFactory.getDocs());
00650     docs.push_back(aFactory.getDocs());
00651     docs.push_back(qFactory.getDocs());
00652     docs.push_back(gFactory.getDocs());
00653     docs.push_back(asFactory.getDocs());
00654 
00655     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < docs.size(); i++) {
00656         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < docs[i].size(); j++) {
00657             if (docs[i][j].getDocName() == query) {
00658                 SelfDoc::printExplanation(docs[i][j],cout);
00659                 exit(0);
00660             }
00661         }
00662     }
00663     Err::errAbort("Didn't find any documentation for: '" + ToStr(query) + "'");
00664 }
00665 
00666 
00667 void EngineUtil::getCelFiles(std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, BaseEngine *engine) {
00668     if (engine->getOpt("cel-files")!="") {
00669         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00670 #ifdef WIN32
00671         tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00672 #endif
00673         std::string celFilesFile = engine->getOpt("cel-files");
00674         string file;
00675         tsv.bind(0, "cel_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00676         if (tsv.open(celFilesFile) != TSV_OK) {
00677             Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cel-files file: " + celFilesFile);
00678         }
00679         tsv.rewind();
00680         while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00681             celFiles.push_back(file);
00682         }
00683         tsv.close();
00684         Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(celFiles.size()) + " cel files from: " + Fs::basename(celFilesFile));
00685     } 
00686     else {
00687         celFiles = engine->getOptVector("cels");
00688         if (celFiles.size() == 0) {
00689             for (vector<const char *>::size_type i = 0; i < engine->getArgCount(); i++)
00690                 celFiles.push_back(engine->getArg(i));
00691         }
00692 #ifdef WIN32
00693         // Windows doesn't do wildcard expansion in windows, let the user know.
00694         if (celFiles.size() > 0 && celFiles[0].find("\*") != string::npos) {
00695             Err::errAbort("Wildcard ('*') expansion not available in windows, please use --cel-files option.");
00696         }
00697 #endif
00698     }
00699 }
00700 
00701 void EngineUtil::getChpFiles(std::vector<std::string> &chpFiles, BaseEngine *engine) {
00702     if (engine->getOpt("chp-files")!="") {
00703         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00704 #ifdef WIN32
00705         tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00706 #endif
00707         std::string chpFilesFile = engine->getOpt("chp-files");
00708         string file;
00709         tsv.bind(0, "chp_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00710         if (tsv.open(chpFilesFile) != TSV_OK) {
00711             Err::errAbort("Couldn't open chp-files file: " + chpFilesFile);
00712         }
00713         tsv.rewind();
00714         while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00715             chpFiles.push_back(file);
00716         }
00717         tsv.close();
00718         Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(chpFiles.size()) + " chp files from: " + Fs::basename(chpFilesFile));
00719     } 
00720     else {
00721         chpFiles = engine->getOptVector("chps");
00722         if (chpFiles.size() == 0) {
00723             for (vector<const char *>::size_type i = 0; i < engine->getArgCount(); i++)
00724                 chpFiles.push_back(engine->getArg(i));
00725         }
00726 #ifdef WIN32
00727         // Windows doesn't do wildcard expansion in windows, let the user know.
00728         if (chpFiles.size() > 0 && chpFiles[0].find("\*") != string::npos) {
00729             Err::errAbort("Wildcard ('*') expansion not available in windows, please use --chp-files option.");
00730         }
00731 #endif
00732     }
00733 }
